com.shelbot.utils

Class VideoButton

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.shelbot.utils.VideoButton

  • public class VideoButton
extends java.lang.Object
    This class models a Button. It can be used to switch between different tabs and is drawn using Processing PApplet.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected java.awt.Color highlightColor 
      protected boolean isHighlight 
      boolean overButton 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      VideoButton(float x, float y, float width, float height, processing.core.PImage img, java.lang.String text, java.lang.String link)
      Creates a new instance of a Button object with a starting x and y coordinate, a button width and height, the text representing the button, the color of the button, and whether or not the button has an icon

    • Constructor Detail

      • VideoButton

        public VideoButton(float x,
                   float y,
                   float width,
                   float height,
                   processing.core.PImage img,
                   java.lang.String text,
                   java.lang.String link)
        Creates a new instance of a Button object with a starting x and y coordinate, a button width and height, the text representing the button, the color of the button, and whether or not the button has an icon
        Parameters:
        x - main x-coordinate of the button
        y - main y-coordinate of the button
        width - the width of the button
        height - the height/length of the button
        img - the snapshot of the video
        text - the title of the video
        link - the link to redirect the VideoButton to

    • Method Detail

      • draw

        public void draw(processing.core.PApplet applet)
        Draws a new instance of a Button object
        Parameters:
        applet - the PApplet to be used to draw the button

      • highlight

        public void highlight(boolean isHighlight)
        Changes the color of the button in order to show that it has been highlighted
        Parameters:
        isHighlight - states whether or not the button is highlighted

      • overButton

        public boolean overButton(int mouseX,
                          int mouseY)
        Determines if the point (x,y) is contained inside a Button object
        Parameters:
        mouseX - the x-coordinate tested for being over the button
        mouseY - the y-coordinate tested for being over the button
        Returns:
        overButton true if overbutton
